segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ … pe … ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhu nissayasampanno hotī”ti?
segments.en: How is a mendicant who is supported defined?”

segments.pli: “Saddhañce, bhikkhu, bhikkhu nissāya akusalaṃ pajahati kusalaṃ bhāveti, pahīnamevassa taṃ akusalaṃ hoti.
segments.en: “Mendicant, if a mendicant supported by faith gives up the unskillful and develops the skillful, the unskillful is actually given up by them.
If a mendicant supported by conscience …
If a mendicant supported by prudence …
If a mendicant supported by energy …

segments.pli: paññañce, bhikkhu, bhikkhu nissāya akusalaṃ pajahati kusalaṃ bhāveti, pahīnamevassa taṃ akusalaṃ hoti.
segments.en: If a mendicant supported by wisdom gives up the unskillful and develops the skillful, the unskillful is actually given up by them.

segments.pli: Taṃ hissa bhikkhuno akusalaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti suppahīnaṃ, yaṃsa ariyāya paññāya disvā pahīnaṃ.
segments.en: What’s been given up is completely given up when it has been given up by seeing with noble wisdom.

segments.pli: Tena ca pana, bhikkhu, bhikkhunā imesu pañcasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya cattāro upanissāya vihātabbā.
segments.en: A mendicant grounded on these five things should rely on four things.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhu, bhikkhu saṅkhāyekaṃ paṭisevati, saṅkhāyekaṃ adhivāseti, saṅkhāyekaṃ parivajjeti, saṅkhāyekaṃ vinodeti.
segments.en: After reflection, a mendicant uses some things, endures some things, avoids some things, and gets rid of some things.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhu, bhikkhu nissayasampanno hotī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant is supported.”
